CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 2, 1961, pg. 3, reads: "8 Isis Way - This gloomy building, set in 'deep valley' behind Forbes Field, houses an elderly couple in its squalid basement. When inspected by the city, earlier this year, the basement was considered unfit for living. - Harris Photos."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "DePaul Smith...A Liability or Asset?  Editor's note: While Pittsburgh (The Renaissance City) proudly displays its renovation of the Golden Triangle, highlights by the $22 million Civic Arena, to its many citizens and visitors, and maps magnificent plans for 'urban renewal, it has 'swept under the rug its 'dregs of human misery' - those displaced persons, a majority of whom are Negroes, who either have not been relocated or are unable to find suitable housing on their own.  Crack Courier reporter Phyl Garland has gone behind the scenes to interview and write about these 'Prisoners of the Ghetto' and their vicious 'jailer.'  This is the second in a series of articles which The Courier offers its readers..."
TitMainTitle: Exterior of two story brick house with stone block facade, ladder back chair on front stoop and telephone pole, 8 Isis Way, Oakland
